title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: warmly welcome contributions browseMetadata project! document provides guidelines contributing repository.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Bug Reports: find bug, please open issue clear description problem steps reproduce . Feature Requests: Suggestions new features improvements always welcome. Please open issue discuss ideas.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Fork Repository: Start forking repository GitHub account. Create Feature Branch: Create new branch feature fix. Make Changes: Implement changes, adhering coding standards practices outlined . Test Changes: Ensure changes break existing functionality. Submit Pull Request: Open pull request feature branch main branch original repository.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Follow tidyverse style guide R code. Write clear, readable, maintainable code. Include comments documentation needed.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Update README documentation necessary. Clearly describe changes ‚Äôve made benefits.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: contribution involves changes R package , specific guidelines follow:

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Creating .rda Files: create .rda files data directory package, use following command R: Replace dataname actual name data. Viewing Package Data: view data included browseMetadata package, execute: Loading Package Data: load specific data package, use: , replace dataname name data wish load.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Generating Documentation Files: build documentation files package, use roxygen2 package: generate necessary documentation based roxygen comments R code.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: Ensure changes break existing functionality. Run existing tests, consider adding new tests cover changes.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: making changes, test thoroughly. Update documentation reflect changes, applicable. Submit pull request clear description changes benefits bring package.

title: Contributing to browseMetadata
text: questions need help, feel free open issue discussion reach maintainers directly. Thank contributing browseMetadata!

what: [1] Health Data Research Innovation Gateway and the connected Metadata Catalogue
title: Metadata tools and resources
text: metadata used input R package browseMetadata ‚Äúmanaged Health Data Research UK collaboration UK Health Data Research Alliance‚Äù ‚Äúsearch-engine ‚Äòportal‚Äô help find health datasets exist UK‚Äù ‚Äúdatasets discoverable Gateway organisations NHS, research institutes charities, part UK Health Data Research Alliance‚Äù related resource HDRUK Phenotype Library, ‚Äúcomprehensive, open access resource providing research community information, tools phenotyping algorithms UK electronic health records.‚Äù See also Concept Library developed SAIL databank team collaborating organisations.

what: [2] British Heart Foundation Data Science Centre (BHF DSC) Dashboard
title: Metadata tools and resources
text: offers ‚Äúoverview interactive summaries datasets currently available CVD-COVID-UK/COVID-IMPACT within secure Trusted Research Environments (TREs) provided NHS England England, National Data Safe Haven Scotland SAIL databank Wales‚Äù dashboard allows explore data dictionaries, data coverage data completeness.

what: Health Data Research Innovation Gateway and the connected Metadata Catalogue
title: Metadata tools and resources
text: metadata used input R package browseMetadata. Managed Health Data Research UK collaboration UK Health Data Research Alliance. information can found Health Data Research Innovation Gateway Metadata Catalogue. Described search-engine ‚Äòportal‚Äô help find health datasets exist UK. datasets discoverable Gateway organisations NHS, research institutes, charities, part UK Health Data Research Alliance. related resource HDRUK Phenotype Library, described comprehensive, open access resource providing research community information, tools, phenotyping algorithms UK electronic health records. Also see Concept Library developed SAIL databank team collaborating organisations.

what: British Heart Foundation Data Science Centre (BHF DSC) Dashboard
title: Metadata tools and resources
text: Offers overview interactive summaries datasets currently available CVD-COVID-UK/COVID-IMPACT within secure Trusted Research Environments (TREs) provided NHS England England, National Data Safe Haven Scotland SAIL databank Wales. dashboard allows exploration data dictionaries, data coverage, data completeness. information can found BHF DSC Dashboard.

text: run function generates log file: Contents: log file includes decisions, date time stamp, Data Class, Data Asset, initials person categorizing. Structure: Data Element DataClass, log file assigns ‚ÄòDomain_code‚Äô, indicating domain categorization. Auto-Categorization: entries auto-categorized. Please review accuracy. Multiple domains can map onto variable. Example: example log file output (left) alongside demo domain list used (right).  Usage: log file can used comparison across users input later analysis steps determine variable representation various domains.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rachael Stickland. Author, maintainer.

text: Stickland R (2023). browseMetadata: Browses available metadata, catergorise label variable dataset. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/aim-rsf/browseMetadata.

what: Browses available metadata, to catergorise or label each variable in a dataset
title: Browses available metadata, to catergorise or label each variable in a dataset
text: R package created help researcher browse health datasets SAIL databank. intended useful earlier stages project, datasets scoped . research team yet got access data can still browse metadata, start address questions : ‚ùì datasets available? ‚ùì datasets need research question? ‚ùì variables within datasets map onto research domains interest? (e.g.¬†socioeconomic factors, childhood adverse events, medical diagnoses, culture community)

what: What does the R package do?
title: Browses available metadata, to catergorise or label each variable in a dataset
text: R package planning tool, designed used alongside tools sources information health datasets research. researcher wants access datasets within SAIL databank, know variables represent concepts care research question? many health datasets, including SAIL, metadata publicly available. R package uses Health Data Research Gateway connected Metadata Catalogue. R package function takes metadata file input facilitates process browsing dataset variable. user asked categorise variable domain related research question, categorisations get saved csv file later reference. speed process, function automatically categorises variables regularly appear health datasets (e.g.¬†ID, Sex, Age). üöß ‚ö†Ô∏è package early development, tested limited number metadata files. theory, package work dataset listed Health Data Research Gateway (just SAIL) long json metadata file can downloaded. practice, tested limited number metadata files SAIL databank.

previous_headings: Getting started with this R package browseMetadata
title: Browses available metadata, to catergorise or label each variable in a dataset
text: Read documentation, run function demo mode: R console show: Respond initials press enter. ask want read description Data Assets Data Classes (tables): Press Y read descriptions, purpose demo. example, Data Asset called MIDS tables inside Data Class BIRTH INITIAL_ASSESSMENT. ask variables process: press enter process variables, use smaller number like 10 demo. data element (variable) shown structure: referencing plots tab, info may , categorise variable number(s). variable can map one domain. (optional) note field explain choice. demo, simple list domains provided, see data-raw/domain_list_demo.csv. list plot tab: [0] MATCH / UNSURE [1] METADATA [2] ALF ID [3] ID [4] DEMOGRAPHICS [5] Socioeconomic factors [6] Location [7] Education [8] Health 5 default domains always included [0-4], appended domain list given. research study, domains likely specific e.g.¬†‚ÄòPrenatal, antenatal, neonatal birth‚Äô ‚ÄòHealth behaviours diet‚Äô.

title: domain_mapping ‚Äî domain_mapping
code: # Run in demo mode by providing no inputs: domain_mapping() # Demo mode will use the /data files provided in this package # Respond with your initials when prompted. # Respond 'Demo List ' for the description of domain list. # Respond 'Y' if you want to see the descriptions printed out. # Respond '1,10' to the RANGE OF VARIABLES prompt (or process the full 93 variables if you like!) # Reference the plot tab and categorise each variable into a single ('1') # or multiple  ('1,2') domain. # Write a note explaining your category choice (optional).

title: Json metadata file ‚Äî json_metadata
text: Example metadata health dataset, demo function domain_mapping.R  data created five steps: Go https://modelcatalogue.cs.ox.ac.uk/hdruk_live/#/catalogue/dataModel/17e86f3f-ec29-4c8e-9efc-8793a74b107d Download json metadata file selecting 'Export JSON' option download button install.packages("rjson") json_metadata <- rjson::fromJSON(file = '/browseMetadata/data-raw/maternity_indicators_dataset_(mids)_20240105T132210.json') usethis::use_data(json_metadata)
